news_header: A passenger train in Norway derailed, resulting in one death and four injuries.
news_text: A passenger train carrying 55 people derailed on Norway's northern coast, leading to one fatality and four injuries. The incident occurred while the train was traveling from Trondheim to Bodoe, reportedly due to a rock slide. Emergency services responded with helicopters, and all passengers were evacuated. The injured were taken to a hospital, though their conditions remain unclear. Images from the scene showed the train's locomotive and one carriage off the tracks.
